DataElement.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Prior Neoadjuvant Therapy Not Qualification Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the reason a person was not suitable for breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, prior to neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Prior Neoadjuvant Therapy Not Qualification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the unsuitability of a person for breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, prior to neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.:used for negation of a word or group of words.:A quality, ability, or accomplishment that makes a person suitable for a particular position or task.

Concepts.definition: Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
used for negation of a word or group of words.
The action of verifying that a person, process, product or piece of equipment is suitable for a particular postition or task.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the assessment performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/23/17 jk added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task; capitalized first word in definition. --- released

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
